channel.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
channel.description:
> #### Mercenary: > * Stand Guard will now also prevent a player from dying. This will prevent the contract from dying to Smite or the Hunter's Bear. If the contract attacks someone guarded by a Knight, the Mercenary will die in the contract's place. A frenzied Assassin will still kill the contract. > * Can no longer start contracted to the Inquisitor, Knight, or Prince.
## Quality of Life: * Possible improvements to connections in-game * Added fill tool to deathnote * Added a streamer mode that can be enabled in the lobby. It creates a separate chat for system messages and night chat, and it creates a separate display for allies. Your room at night will be replaced with a shot of the throne at night.
## General: * Added Spectator mode for custom games. * Mercenary reworked.
## Minor Class/Ability Changes: > #### Fool: > * Hide now grants death immunity instead of preventing visitors. > > #### Knight: > * Will no longer attack players when using Cold Steel if they are redirected. > > #### Mystic: > * Link Minds & Conduit will no longer work on Illusionist or Apostle. > > #### Paladin: > * Smite can't be used until Night 4.
## Major Class/Ability Changes: > #### Mercenary: > * Can no longer get a second contract. > * Can no longer be converted. > * Passive Contracted - Occupy and redirection immune. > * Day Ability Connections - Force the court to pardon your contract. 1 use. > * Night Ability Stand Guard - Works just like before, but no longer notifies target. 4 uses. > * Night Ability Rebound - Prevent and kill everyone visiting your contract.

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
I will refuse to contract a prince if he did that. I will make sure he dies somehow

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
it is a good point there. Personally I’m fine with the random contract. Just saying IMO that should be required IF merc is going to pick it’s contract. The last thing we should want is either merc becoming non-scum claimable again via the confirmation pop-up, or making the prince out meta even more safe via prince demanding any merc’s to contract him on day 2.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Bart_Auringer
item.description:
Then Merc can find classses, which seems wrong.

“Oh he’s actually a knight like he says because I couldn’t contract him.”

And if the Prince-out meta ever leaves he’ll be able to find the Prince.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
IMO this would also need to be combined with… contract does not require confirmation or grant notification to the recipient. The same blacklist should also be in play (no contracts for prince). Perhaps just a message for the merc saying “contract may not be selected”. but allow a re-use.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I feel this is the way to go now that we have the one contract thing:

Mercenary Suggestion

A lot of people are complaining that it is against the rules to bus your first contract. I have a suggestion that would both fix this problem while simultaneously making the mercenary more fun to play.

Simply let the Mercenary choose their first contract!
If they haven’t picked a contract by N2, they commit suicide.

This puts the burden of choosing a good contract on the Mercenary themselves, so they can’t complain about ‘randomly rolling the NK’ and not wanting to protect them.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: methomps
item.description:
Any idea what message an assassin gets if he attacks a bear/guard and the merc takes the hit?

There’s going to be a few assassins busted for claiming knight with a merc.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
Here are the updated changes to Mercenary:

Ellie:

Mercenary:

Stand Guard will now also prevent a player from dying.

This will prevent the contract from dying to Smite or the Hunter’s Bear. If the contract attacks someone guarded by a Knight, the Mercenary will die in the contract’s place.

A frenzied Assassin will still kill the contract.
Can no longer start contracted to the Inquisitor, Knight, or Prince.

I am happy to see the removal of Prince from possible contracts.
Removing Inquistor from contracts is a good idea. The Sorcerer has a hard enough time as it is.

Removing Knight is questionable. I would like to know the reason behind that change…

Edit: Ah. Knights frequently kill themselves and the new Merc cannot re-contract. That makes sense.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.1 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
Solic:

Here is scum’s counter: poison mercenary’s target and then convert them. I definitely do disagree with the mercenary’s changes. It is way harder to keep a starting assassin or knight alive as opposed to other classes. The option of having a second contract smoothed out that randomness.

Here is the BD counter to this:
OBSERVER+SCOUT=GG
